meanings.definition: A person who poses, especially for a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The posier smiled for the camera during the photo shoot.
meanings.sent2: The talented posier knew how to strike different poses effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The posier pretended to be a famous model for fun.
meanings.sent4: She was a natural posier, effortlessly embodying different characters in front of the lens.
meanings.sent5: The posier's ability to convey emotions through poses made the photos captivating.

meanings.definition: To assume a particular attitude or position, typically for a photograph.
meanings.sent1: She would posier in front of the mirror to practice her modeling poses.
meanings.sent2: Posier carefully to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: He decided to posier like a superhero for the group picture.

meanings.sent5: Posiering with confidence can make a photo stand out from the rest.

meanings.definition: A device used for holding a camera steady.
meanings.sent1: The posier helped capture clear images by stabilizing the camera.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a posier when taking long exposure shots.
meanings.sent3: The photographer always carried a reliable posier in his bag.
meanings.sent4: The lightweight posier was essential for shooting videos without shaking.
meanings.sent5: The new posier model had advanced features for professional photographers.
